result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier J. Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.    
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Do not reside with any person or any place in which children reside.  May not have contact with victim except as permitted by Domestic Relations Court.  Not to reside with victim. Not to reside with anyone of the opposite sex unless related by blood.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal chage made against the deft.
**  Court costs from Ct. 1 to be paid during probation **

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED  -  CT. 6 IS CONSECUTIVE TO CT. 4  -  ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE COLLECTED.

Not to reside with anyone of the opposite sex unless related by blood.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.
***Court costs from Ct. 1 to be paid during probation**

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 091516 sentencing after revocation hearing paid by county $32.00.
9/15/16 - Sentencing Hearing on Revocation
2yrs WSP on each count 4 & count 6 consecutive.  Initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6mos of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP on each - count 4 & count 6; sentences are consecutive.  Initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6mos of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 148 days.  Appeal rights.
revoc summary

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Ct. 1
Court costs on Ct. 1 are to be paid during probation in his other counts per TL.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Mary Losey.  Victim rights compliance; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1 - sentenced to 90 days KCJ consec to present sentence.  Huber allowed.    It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Remaining counts - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent but consecutive to count 1.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on June 1, 2015 at 1:45 pm.

Minutes:   Reporter - Karen Howell.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Mary Losey.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 4, & 6; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  Sentencing adj to 5/20/15 @ 1:30pm to allow the court to review files 14CM912 & 14CM668 as well as the revocation summary in those files.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
